item.title: Nacelle Anti-Ice VALVE Lights or NAI Indications – Valve Verified Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated valve is verified to be operative before each departure in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard on NAI VALVE switch Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "NAI VLV IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To verify valve associated with inoperative VALVE light or NAI indication is operative, perform the following procedure:
Pressurize the pneumatic system with either a ground air source or with the APU (AMM 36-00-00/201).

warning.para: ENGINES MUST NOT BE RUNNING WHEN PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT ARE NEARBY.

numlitem.para: Manually open the associated engine PRSOV (AMM 36-11-04/201).
Gain access to the associated nacelle anti-ice valve assembly on the nacelle anti-ice duct. Access panel is located on the left side of the strut forward fairing, No. 3 fairing:
Locate the valve position indicator hex nut adjacent to the valve manual override selector. Hex nut has position pointer indicating OPEN or CLOSED. The manual override selector must remain at NORMAL.
Verify that nacelle anti-ice valve opens:
Position associated Anti-Ice/Rain Removal panel (P5) NACELLE ANTI-ICE switch ON.

caution.para: IF THE PNEUMATIC AIR IS HOT (APPROXIMATELY 350ºF), DO NOT OPEN THE ENGINE INLET ANTI-ICE VALVE FOR MORE THAN 30 SECONDS. AFTER THE VALVE CLOSES, LET THE INLET COWL BECOME COOL. TOO MUCH HEAT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE INLET COWL.

numlitem.para: Visually confirm that the valve position indicator hex nut rotates toward OPEN.
Verify that nacelle anti-ice valve closes:
Position associated Anti-Ice/Rain Removal panel (P5) NACELLE ANTI-ICE switch OFF.
Visually confirm that the valve position indicator hex nut rotates to indicate CLOSED.
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
